-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | Multivariate Dirichlet distribution
--   
--   Please see the README on GitHub at
--   <a>https://github.com/dschrempf/dirichlet#readme</a>
@package dirichlet
@version 0.1.0.7


-- | Creation date: Tue Oct 20 10:10:39 2020.
module Statistics.Distribution.Dirichlet

-- | The <a>Dirichlet distribution</a>.
data DirichletDistribution

-- | Create a Dirichlet distribution from the given parameter vector.
--   
--   Return Left if:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The parameter vector has less then two elements.</li>
--   <li>One or more parameters are negative or zero.</li>
--   </ul>
dirichletDistribution :: Vector Double -> Either String DirichletDistribution

-- | Density of the Dirichlet distribution evaluated at a given value
--   vector.
--   
--   Return 0 if:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The value vector has a different length than the parameter
--   vector.</li>
--   <li>The value vector has elements being negative or zero.</li>
--   <li>The value vector does not sum to 1.0 (with tolerance <tt>eps =
--   1e-14</tt>).</li>
--   </ul>
dirichletDensity :: DirichletDistribution -> Vector Double -> Log Double

-- | Sample a value vector from the Dirichlet distribution.
dirichletSample :: StatefulGen g m => DirichletDistribution -> g -> m (Vector Double)

-- | See <a>DirichletDistribution</a> but with parameter vector
--   <tt>replicate DIM VAL</tt>.
data DirichletDistributionSymmetric

-- | Create a symmetric Dirichlet distribution of given dimension and
--   parameter.
--   
--   Return Left if:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The given dimension is smaller than two.</li>
--   <li>The parameter is negative or zero.</li>
--   </ul>
dirichletDistributionSymmetric :: Int -> Double -> Either String DirichletDistributionSymmetric

-- | Density of the symmetric Dirichlet distribution evaluated at a given
--   value vector.
--   
--   Return 0 if:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The value vector has a different dimension.</li>
--   <li>The value vector has elements being negative or zero.</li>
--   <li>The value vector does not sum to 1.0 (with tolerance <tt>eps =
--   1e-14</tt>).</li>
--   </ul>
dirichletDensitySymmetric :: DirichletDistributionSymmetric -> Vector Double -> Log Double

-- | Sample a value vector from the symmetric Dirichlet distribution.
dirichletSampleSymmetric :: StatefulGen g m => DirichletDistributionSymmetric -> g -> m (Vector Double)
instance GHC.Show.Show Statistics.Distribution.Dirichlet.DirichletDistribution
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Statistics.Distribution.Dirichlet.DirichletDistribution
instance GHC.Show.Show Statistics.Distribution.Dirichlet.DirichletDistributionSymmetric
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Statistics.Distribution.Dirichlet.DirichletDistributionSymmetric
